citeinfo.title: Coal Fields of the Conterminous United States: National Coal Resource Assessment Updated Version, Coal Provinces

descript.abstract: This dataset is a polygon shapefile representing the provinces of the coal fields of the conterminous United States. Resolution of data is 1:5,000,000. This data is based on an early USGS paper map that was a representation of the coal fields and major regions (Trumbull, 1960). The map was digitized and the provinces were added to the PDF portion of USGS OFR 96-092, Coal Fields of the Conterminous United States (Tully, 1996). The provinces were not included in the GIS portion of the publication, so it was necessary to digitize them for this publication.
descript.purpose: This dataset was compiled to update the Coal Fields Map of the Conterminous United States, OFR 96-092. The provinces did not exist in a GIS format, so a shapefile of their boundaries was created.
descript.supplinf: Sources used in the abstract and purpose include: > Trumbull, J., 1960. Coal Fields of the United States (sheet 1): U.S. Geological Survey map. Scale 1:5,000,000. > Tully, J., 1996. Coal Fields of the Conterminous United States. U.S. Geological Survey Open File Report 96-92. Scale 1:5,000,000.

theme.themekt: Alexandria Digital Library Feature Type Thesaurus

theme.themekey: Coal Fields Map of North America

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows Vista Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.0.1770

attracc.attraccr: Attribute accuracy was tested by manual comparison of the source with georeferenced digital printouts of the original USGS OFR 96-092.

dataqual.logic: Map elements were visually checked for overshoots, undershoots, duplicates, polygon closure and proper attribution.
dataqual.complete: Data set complete. No data was intentionally omitted from the hard copy and digital source maps.

horizpa.horizpar: The shapefile is based on the Tully (1996) PDF.map. The shapefile was digitized by hand, with a RMS error not exceeding .005 when coordinating the digitizer. Visual comparison of the basins with the digital geologic map of North America displayed some offset, with the maximum being around 1 km.

citeinfo.title: Coal Fields of the United States (sheet 1)

srcinfo.srccontr: Original Paper Map of the Coal Fields

citeinfo.title: Coal Fields of the Conterminous United States

srcinfo.typesrc: PDF of map, and Arc Info Coverage.
srcinfo.srccontr: Digital update of Trumbull 1960 used as base GIS for project

procstep.procdesc: The Coal provinces shapefile was digitized by hand from the printed PDF of OFR 96-092 (Tully, 1996). The projection of the printed map was Albers, so the digitized coverage was projected from Albers into geographic with a datum of NAD 1983. The coverage was exported as a shapefile and the polygons were populated with a Name attribute.

enttyp.enttypd: Six geographic provinces of the conterminous United States divided based on regional coal location.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Province that coal polygon falls within

Graphical map depictions are intended to be used within the map scale limits applicable to the source data. Although software enables the user to view data at various scales, the user is cautioned to refer to the source documentation for the appropriate map scale limitations.
